Key Match Events: Pakistan won by 1 wicket with 4 balls remaining.
Mohammad Rizwan scored 192 runs from three innings in the tournament.
Mohammad Nawaz scored 42 off 20 balls against India in the previous match.
Naseem Shah picked up five wickets in three matches in the competition.
Pre-Game Insights: A win will take Pakistan to the final while Afghanistan will be keen to open their account in the Super 4s.
Pakistan and Afghanistan are familiar with the conditions in UAE.
Pakistan have a perfect record against Afghanistan in T20Is, having won both matches in 2013 and 2019.
Afghanistan no longer just rely on the spin trio of Rashid Khan, Mujeeb Ur Rahman, and captain Mohammad Nabi for wickets.
Afghanistan's fast bowlers Fazalhaq Farooqi and Naveen-ul-Haq have emerged as match-winners.
Najibullah Zadran, Rahmanullah Gurbaz, and Ibrahim Zadran have stepped up in the batting department for Afghanistan.
Pakistan have been able to put up convincing victories despite injuries to key players and their captain being out of form.
Mohammad Rizwan has done well to cover for Babar Azam.
Pakistan's bowling remains their biggest strength with spinners Shadab Khan and Mohammad Nawaz sharing 13 wickets between them from three matches.
Naseem Shah has starred with five wickets from three matches.
Rahmanullah Gurbaz is coming off an 84 off 45 balls against Sri Lanka.
The team batting first will be looking to score big in Sharjah.
Rizwan, who injured his knee, has been cleared to play by the Pakistan medical team.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Pakistan have won both their T20Is against Afghanistan in the past.
Shadab Khan's economy rate of 5.43 is the best among Pakistan players at this Asia Cup.
Rashid Khan has dismissed Babar Azam five times in T20s, conceding 58 runs off 48 balls.
